column10: b"b' Hi @desunit can you have a look at this? Is this the best way to do this?'"
b"b' Yes
column11: the fact that it was just getting response names concerned me.  I originally filtered out duplicates in the CreateRestPaths method but this felt a little awkward.  Is there a way to get a non duplicated list of operations or do we need to go back to de-duplicating allOperations?'"

column10: b'b" I\'m hoping already returns a non-duplicated list of all operation names. Is this not the case with the latest version of ServiceStack? To get a unique list just convert it to a hash set with the extension method:  "'

b'b\' (); does return a non-duplicated list of operation names.  The problem is that we want a non-duplicated list of resources.  There can be multiple operartions that are relevant to the same resource.  In RazorRockstars both Rockstars and Rockstar use the resource "/rockstars". I have reverted to my original approach
column11: which is to filter duplicates in the method CreateRestPaths.  If there is a better way
column12: for example one that can find the RestPaths from the Service type
column13: then feel free to suggest that.\''

column10: b"b' PopulateWithNonDefaultValues handle nullables'"
b'b\' For nullable properties
column11: treat null as the default value
column13: including the default value of the underlying value type
column14: asnon-default. Allows using PopulateWithNonDefaultValues to populate bothtrue and false values if the source property is a nullable boolean
column15: forexample. Detailed example: This has always worked
column16: because of the check in  : This has always worked
column18: is auto-boxed asBoolean object with value of true
column19: so and  will return  . Here is what we want to change: when a nullable bool has a value of false
column20: we wereexpecting this to be treated as "non default" since it\\\'s not null. The current code howeverwill treat a nullable boolean with a value of false (or a nullable int with value of zero
column21: etc.)as a "default" value and refuse to update the destination object. We changed this behavior by passing the info into the lambda
column22: and using that type info in instead of using  .Basically
column24: will actually give you the typeobject instead of
column25: thus will return instead of  . See [comments and answers in this post]url  for more details on why doesn\\\'t work well with nullables. **Question:** is there any concern about changing the behavior of in this way?\''

column10: b'b" Here\'s a more concrete example of why I want to make this change. Given a DTO: And existing data (note that BoolValue is currently
column11: not false or null): And a PATCH request attempting to set that boolean value to false: And a service implementation: Currently
column12: PopulateWithNonDefaultValues will basically treat a nullable bool the same as a regular bool
column13: and treat the value in the request object as a default value and ignore it. Thus
column14: the data will not get updated. This pull request will treat as a non-default value for a nullable bool
column15: allowing us to explicitly set that property to false using the given PATCH request. Currently we need a workaround like this:  ."'

column10: b"b' Multiple encoding support in HttpMultipart class'"
b"b' Fixing a TODO item. Needed this for parsing SendGrid multi-part posts. More details here url '"

b"b' This is modifying the code-base that was originally from url  which seems to have changed significantly since. The ideal solution will instead be to re-sync with the current Mono impl of HttpRequest which changes how they were handling ContentEncoding. Can you also please include tests with future pull requests showing why the change was needed and to prevent future regressions.'"
b"b' From the first glance
column11: in the Mono HttpRequest class they do not have Encoding property in the Element class and assume that all parts in -data are encoded the same way with ContentEncoding property of the HttpRequest class

column10: b"b' _You appear to be correct!_ In the [LoadMultiPart]url  method
column11: it reads the ContentEncoding once when it initializes the HttpMultipart class from the request header.  Then during the [ReadNextElement]url  method it reads the Content-Type
column12: but does not account for a change in the charset. Inclusive to your reference
column14: it has further information regarding the charset parameter for the Content-Type field and never states anywhere that their is one encoding for all message
column15: just a default if one is not specified.  I mention RFC 2046 because that is what is referenced in their code. **You should submit a pull request to the Mono project and see what comes of it.**'"

column10: b"b' Pull request for mono is too much for me
column11: I do not have time or ability to understand its internals. I have made a third commit for this pull request after it was closed by mythz. There I use already existing GetParam method to read charset param (instead of split
column12: etc that mythz complained about) the same method that original class uses to read default charset. I just want to have ServiceStack with support for multi-part non utf before mono changes its code and do not want to maintain my own repo

column10: b'b" Ok tho I don\'t see a new pull-req? It should ideally come with a test which will help prevent future regressions when we re-sync with Mono\'s code-base. "'

b'b" I\'ve had a look at the history of HttpListenerRequestWrapper and it\'s undergone a fair amount of change to the ported code that it will be hard to re-sync with the code-base without losing many of these fixes. So I\'ll just merge this instead and re-factor it on my side
column11: thx."'

column10: b"b' Thank you! Next time will do a cleaner job. But probability that SS has any other issues is near zero though :)'"
b"b' Add RememberMe support to AuthService Authenticate API method'"

b'b\' This patch adds "Remember Me" (ss-opt) support for callers of the  method. The Post method of the auth. service supports persisting the users RememberMe preference for sessions (ss-opt cookie). The public API method "Authenticate" looks like it should also support this behaviour to enable persistent user sessions
column11: but it currently doesn\\\'t. When calling the service from code (say MVC)
column12: you\\\'re required to put this fragment of code in each of the calling clients
column13: rather than the service.  This was confirmed by another user on stackoverflow: url \''
